an2.180-184:0.2.eng: The Chapter of Abbreviated Texts Beginning With Anger

an2.180-184:1.3.pli: Kodho ca upanāho ca … makkho ca paḷāso ca … issā ca macchariyañca … māyā ca sāṭheyyañca … ahirikañca anottappañca.
an2.180-184:1.3.eng: Anger and acrimony … disdain and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.

an2.185-189:1.3.pli: Akkodho ca anupanāho ca … amakkho ca apaḷāso ca … anissā ca amacchariyañca … amāyā ca asāṭheyyañca … hirī ca ottappañca.
an2.185-189:1.3.eng: Freedom from anger and acrimony … freedom from disdain and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.

an2.190-194:1.1.eng: “Anyone who has two things lives in suffering.

an2.190-194:1.3.pli: Kodhena ca upanāhena ca … makkhena ca paḷāsena ca … issāya ca macchariyena ca … māyāya ca sāṭheyyena ca … ahirikena ca anottappena ca.
an2.190-194:1.3.eng: Anger and acrimony … disdain and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.

an2.190-194:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato dukkhaṃ viharati”.
an2.190-194:1.4.eng: Anyone who has these two things lives in suffering.”

an2.195-199:1.1.eng: “Anyone who has these two things lives happily.

an2.195-199:1.3.pli: Akkodhena ca anupanāhena ca … amakkhena ca apaḷāsena ca … anissāya ca amacchariyena ca … amāyāya ca asāṭheyyena ca … hiriyā ca ottappena ca.
an2.195-199:1.3.eng: Freedom from anger and acrimony … freedom from disdain and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.

an2.195-199:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato sukhaṃ viharati”.
an2.195-199:1.4.eng: Anyone who has these two things lives happily.”

an2.200-204:1.1.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
an2.200-204:1.1.eng: “These two things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

an2.200-204:1.3.pli: Kodho ca upanāho ca … makkho ca paḷāso ca … issā ca macchariyañca … māyā ca sāṭheyyañca … ahirikañca anottappañca.
an2.200-204:1.3.eng: Anger and acrimony … disdain and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.

an2.200-204:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti”.
an2.200-204:1.4.eng: These two things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”

an2.205-209:1.1.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
an2.205-209:1.1.eng: “These two things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

an2.205-209:1.3.pli: Akkodho ca anupanāho ca … amakkho ca apaḷāso ca … anissā ca amacchariyañca … amāyā ca asāṭheyyañca … hirī ca ottappañca.
an2.205-209:1.3.eng: Freedom from anger and acrimony … freedom from disdain and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.

an2.205-209:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti”.
an2.205-209:1.4.eng: These two things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”

an2.210-214:1.1.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an2.210-214:1.1.eng: “Anyone who has two things is cast down to hell.

an2.210-214:1.3.pli: Kodhena ca upanāhena ca … makkhena ca paḷāsena ca … issāya ca macchariyena ca … māyāya ca sāṭheyyena ca … ahirikena ca anottappena ca.
an2.210-214:1.3.eng: Anger and acrimony … disdain and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.

an2.210-214:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye”.
an2.210-214:1.4.eng: Anyone who has these two things is cast down to hell.”

an2.215-219:1.1.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an2.215-219:1.1.eng: “Anyone who has two things is raised up to heaven.

an2.215-219:1.3.pli: Akkodhena ca anupanāhena ca … amakkhena ca apaḷāsena ca … anissāya ca amacchariyena ca … amāyāya ca asāṭheyyena ca … hiriyā ca ottappena ca.
an2.215-219:1.3.eng: Freedom from anger and acrimony … freedom from disdain and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.

an2.215-219:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”.
an2.215-219:1.4.eng: Anyone who has these two things is raised up to heaven.”

an2.220-224:1.1.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato idhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati.
an2.220-224:1.1.eng: “When they have two things, some people, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

an2.220-224:1.3.pli: Kodhena ca upanāhena ca … makkhena ca paḷāsena ca … issāya ca macchariyena ca … māyāya ca sāṭheyyena ca … ahirikena ca anottappena ca.
an2.220-224:1.3.eng: Anger and acrimony … disdain and contempt … jealousy and stinginess … deceit and deviousness … lack of conscience and prudence.

an2.220-224:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato idhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjati”.
an2.220-224:1.4.eng: When they have two things, some people, when their body breaks up, after death, are reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.”

an2.225-229:1.1.pli: “Dvīhi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato idhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati.
an2.225-229:1.1.eng: “When they have two things, some people—when their body breaks up, after death—are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

an2.225-229:1.3.pli: Akkodhena ca anupanāhena ca … amakkhena ca apaḷāsena ca … anissāya ca amacchariyena ca … amāyāya ca asāṭheyyena ca … hiriyā ca ottappena ca.
an2.225-229:1.3.eng: Freedom from anger and acrimony … freedom from disdain and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.

an2.225-229:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dvīhi dhammehi samannāgato idhekacco kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjati”.
an2.225-229:1.4.eng: When they have these two things, some people—when their body breaks up, after death—are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”

an2.21:1.3.pli: Yo ca accayaṃ accayato na passati, yo ca accayaṃ desentassa yathādhammaṃ nappaṭiggaṇhāti.
an2.21:1.3.eng: One who doesn’t recognize when they’ve made a mistake. And one who doesn’t properly accept the confession of someone who’s made a mistake.

an2.21:2.1.eng: There are two who are astute.

an2.21:2.3.pli: Yo ca accayaṃ accayato passati, yo ca accayaṃ desentassa yathādhammaṃ paṭiggaṇhāti.
an2.21:2.3.eng: One who recognizes when they’ve made a mistake. And one who properly accepts the confession of someone who’s made a mistake.

an2.21:2.4.eng: These are the two who are astute.”

an2.22:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these two misrepresent the Realized One.

an2.22:1.3.pli: Duṭṭho vā dosantaro, saddho vā duggahitena.
an2.22:1.3.eng: One who is hateful and hides it, and one whose faith is mistaken.

an2.22:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve tathāgataṃ abbhācikkhantī”ti.
an2.22:1.4.eng: These two misrepresent the Realized One.”

an2.23:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these two misrepresent the Realized One.

an2.23:1.3.pli: Yo ca abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatena bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti, yo ca bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatena abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti.
an2.23:1.3.eng: One who explains what was not spoken by the Realized One as spoken by him. And one who explains what was spoken by the Realized One as not spoken by him.

an2.23:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve tathāgataṃ abbhācikkhantīti.
an2.23:1.4.eng: These two misrepresent the Realized One.

an2.23:2.1.eng: These two don’t misrepresent the Realized One.

an2.23:2.3.pli: Yo ca abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatena abhāsitaṃ alapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti, yo ca bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatena bhāsitaṃ lapitaṃ tathāgatenāti dīpeti.
an2.23:2.3.eng: One who explains what was not spoken by the Realized One as not spoken by him. And one who explains what was spoken by the Realized One as spoken by him.

an2.23:2.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve tathāgataṃ nābbhācikkhantī”ti.
an2.23:2.4.eng: These two don’t misrepresent the Realized One.”

an2.24:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these two misrepresent the Realized One.

an2.24:1.3.pli: Yo ca neyyatthaṃ suttantaṃ nītattho suttantoti dīpeti, yo ca nītatthaṃ suttantaṃ neyyattho suttantoti dīpeti.
an2.24:1.3.eng: One who explains a discourse in need of interpretation as a discourse whose meaning is explicit. And one who explains a discourse whose meaning is explicit as a discourse in need of interpretation.

an2.24:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve tathāgataṃ abbhācikkhantī”ti.
an2.24:1.4.eng: These two misrepresent the Realized One.”

an2.25:1.1.eng: “These two don’t misrepresent the Realized One.

an2.25:1.3.pli: Yo ca neyyatthaṃ suttantaṃ neyyattho suttantoti dīpeti, yo ca nītatthaṃ suttantaṃ nītattho suttantoti dīpeti.
an2.25:1.3.eng: One who explains a discourse in need of interpretation as a discourse in need of interpretation. And one who explains a discourse whose meaning is explicit as a discourse whose meaning is explicit.

an2.25:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve tathāgataṃ nābbhācikkhantī”ti.
an2.25:1.4.eng: These two don’t misrepresent the Realized One.”

an2.26:1.1.pli: “Paṭicchannakammantassa, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññatarā gati pāṭikaṅkhā—
an2.26:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, one who is underhand can expect one of two destinies:

an2.26:2.1.pli: Appaṭicchannakammantassa, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññatarā gati pāṭikaṅkhā—
an2.26:2.1.eng: One who is aboveboard can expect one of two destinies:

an2.26:2.2.eng: as a god or a human.”

an2.27:1.1.pli: “Micchādiṭṭhikassa, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññatarā gati pāṭikaṅkhā—
an2.27:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, one who has wrong view can expect one of two destinies:

an2.28:1.1.pli: “Sammādiṭṭhikassa, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññatarā gati pāṭikaṅkhā—
an2.28:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, one who has right view can expect one of two destinies:

an2.28:1.2.eng: as a god or a human.”

an2.29:1.1.eng: “There are two places waiting to receive an unethical person:

an2.29:2.1.eng: There are two places waiting to receive an ethical person:

an2.29:2.2.eng: the realms of gods and humans.”

an2.30:1.1.pli: “Dvāhaṃ, bhikkhave, atthavase sampassamāno araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmi.
an2.30:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I see two reasons to frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.

an2.30:1.3.pli: Attano ca diṭṭhadhammasukhavihāraṃ sampassamāno, pacchimañca janataṃ anukampamāno.
an2.30:1.3.eng: Seeing happiness for oneself in this life, and having sympathy for future generations.

an2.30:1.4.pli: Ime kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, dve atthavase sampassamāno araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevāmī”ti.
an2.30:1.4.eng: I see two reasons to frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest.”

an2.31:1.1.eng: “These two things play a part in realization.

an2.31:1.4.eng: What is the benefit of developing serenity?

an2.31:1.6.eng: What is the benefit of developing the mind?

an2.31:1.8.eng: What is the benefit of developing discernment?

an2.31:1.10.eng: What is the benefit of developing wisdom?

an2.31:1.12.pli: Rāgupakkiliṭṭhaṃ vā, bhikkhave, cittaṃ na vimuccati, avijjupakkiliṭṭhā vā paññā na bhāvīyati.
an2.31:1.12.eng: The mind corrupted by greed is not free; and wisdom corrupted by ignorance does not grow.

an2.31:1.13.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, rāgavirāgā cetovimutti, avijjāvirāgā paññāvimuttī”ti.
an2.31:1.13.eng: In this way, freedom of heart comes from the fading away of greed, while freedom by wisdom comes from the fading away of ignorance.”

an2.230-279:0.2.eng: The Chapter of Abbreviated Texts Beginning With the Unskillful

an2.230-279:1.1.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā akusalā … dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā kusalā … dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā sāvajjā … dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā anavajjā … dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā dukkhudrayā … dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā sukhudrayā … dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā dukkhavipākā … dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā sukhavipākā … dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā sabyābajjhā … dveme, bhikkhave, dhammā abyābajjhā.
an2.230-279:1.1.eng: “These two things are unskillful … are skillful … are blameworthy … are blameless … have suffering as outcome … have happiness as outcome … result in suffering … result in happiness … are hurtful … are not hurtful.

an2.230-279:1.3.pli: Akkodho ca anupanāho ca … amakkho ca apaḷāso ca … anissā ca amacchariyañca … amāyā ca asāṭheyyañca … hirī ca ottappañca.
an2.230-279:1.3.eng: Freedom from anger and acrimony … freedom from disdain and contempt … freedom from jealousy and stinginess … freedom from deceit and deviousness … conscience and prudence.

an2.230-279:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve dhammā abyābajjhā”ti.
an2.230-279:1.4.eng: These are the two things that are not hurtful.”

an2.280:0.2.eng: The Chapter of Abbreviated Texts on Monastic Law

an2.280:1.1.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ.
an2.280:1.1.eng: “For two reasons the Realized One laid down training rules for his disciples.

an2.280:1.3.pli: Saṅghasuṭṭhutāya saṅghaphāsutāya … dummaṅkūnaṃ puggalānaṃ niggahāya, pesalānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ phāsuvihārāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ āsavānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ āsavānaṃ paṭighātāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ verānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ verānaṃ paṭighātāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ vajjānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ vajjānaṃ paṭighātāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ bhayānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ bhayānaṃ paṭighātāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭighātāya … gihīnaṃ anukampāya, pāpicchānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pakkhupacchedāya … appasannānaṃ pasādāya, pasannānaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya … saddhammaṭṭhitiyā vinayānuggahāya.
an2.280:1.3.eng: For the well-being and comfort of the Saṅgha … For keeping difficult individuals in check and for the comfort of good-hearted mendicants … For restraining defilements that affect this life and protecting against defilements that affect lives to come … For restraining threats to this life and protecting against threats to lives to come … For restraining faults that affect this life and protecting against faults that affect lives to come … For restraining hazards that affect this life and protecting against hazards that affect lives to come … For restraining unskillful qualities that affect this life and protecting against unskillful qualities that affect lives to come … Out of sympathy for laypeople and for breaking up factions of mendicants with corrupt wishes … For inspiring confidence in those without it, and increasing confidence in those who have it … For the continuation of the true teaching and the support of the training.

an2.280:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattan”ti.
an2.280:1.4.eng: These are the two reasons why the Realized One laid down training rules for his disciples.”

an2.281-309:1.1.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ pātimokkhaṃ paññattaṃ …pe… pātimokkhuddeso paññatto … pātimokkhaṭṭhapanaṃ paññattaṃ … pavāraṇā paññattā … pavāraṇaṭṭhapanaṃ paññattaṃ … tajjanīyakammaṃ paññattaṃ … niyassakammaṃ paññattaṃ … pabbājanīyakammaṃ paññattaṃ … paṭisāraṇīyakammaṃ paññattaṃ … ukkhepanīyakammaṃ paññattaṃ … parivāsadānaṃ paññattaṃ … mūlāyapaṭikassanaṃ paññattaṃ … mānattadānaṃ paññattaṃ … abbhānaṃ paññattaṃ … osāraṇīyaṃ paññattaṃ … nissāraṇīyaṃ paññattaṃ … upasampadā paññattā … ñattikammaṃ paññattaṃ … ñattidutiyakammaṃ paññattaṃ … ñatticatutthakammaṃ paññattaṃ … apaññatte paññattaṃ … paññatte anupaññattaṃ … sammukhāvinayo paññatto … sativinayo paññatto … amūḷhavinayo paññatto … paṭiññātakaraṇaṃ paññattaṃ … yebhuyyasikā paññattā … tassapāpiyasikā paññattā … tiṇavatthārako paññatto.
an2.281-309:1.1.eng: “For two reasons the Realized One laid down for his disciples the monastic code … the recitation of the monastic code … the suspension of the recitation of the monastic code … the invitation to admonish … the setting aside of the invitation to admonish … the disciplinary act of condemnation … placing under dependence … banishment … reconciliation … debarment … probation … being sent back to the beginning … penance … reinstatement … restoration … removal … ordination … an act with a motion … an act with a motion and one announcement … an act with a motion and three announcements … laying down what was not previously laid down … amending what was laid down … the settling of a disciplinary matter by the following methods: face-to-face … through recollection … because of past insanity … acting according to what has been admitted … majority decision … further penalty…  covering over as if with grass.

an2.281-309:1.3.pli: Saṅghasuṭṭhutāya, saṅghaphāsutāya … dummaṅkūnaṃ puggalānaṃ niggahāya, pesalānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ phāsuvihārāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ āsavānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ āsavānaṃ paṭighātāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ verānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ verānaṃ paṭighātāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ vajjānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ vajjānaṃ paṭighātāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ bhayānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ bhayānaṃ paṭighātāya … diṭṭhadhammikānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ saṃvarāya, samparāyikānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ paṭighātāya … gihīnaṃ anukampāya, pāpicchānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pakkhupacchedāya … appasannānaṃ pasādāya, pasannānaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya … saddhammaṭṭhitiyā, vinayānuggahāya.
an2.281-309:1.3.eng: For the well-being and comfort of the Saṅgha … For keeping difficult individuals in check and for the comfort of good-hearted mendicants … For restraining defilements that affect this life and protecting against defilements that affect lives to come … For restraining threats to this life and protecting against threats to lives to come … For restraining faults that affect this life and protecting against faults that affect lives to come … For restraining hazards that affect this life and protecting against hazards that affect lives to come … For restraining unskillful qualities that affect this life and protecting against unskillful qualities that affect lives to come … Out of sympathy for laypeople and for breaking up factions of mendicants with corrupt wishes … For inspiring confidence in those without it, and increasing confidence in those who have it … For the continuation of the true teaching and the support of the training.

an2.281-309:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve atthavase paṭicca tathāgatena sāvakānaṃ tiṇavatthārako paññatto”ti.
an2.281-309:1.4.eng: These are the two reasons why the Realized One laid down the settlement of a disciplinary matter by covering over with grass for his disciples.”

an2.310-319:0.2.eng: The Chapter of Abbreviated Texts Beginning with Greed

an2.310-319:1.1.eng: “For insight into greed, two things should be developed.

an2.310-319:1.4.pli: Rāgassa, bhikkhave, abhiññāya ime dve dhammā bhāvetabbā”ti.
an2.310-319:1.4.eng: For insight into greed, these two things should be developed.”

an2.310-319:2.1.pli: “Rāgassa, bhikkhave, pariññāya … parikkhayāya … pahānāya … khayāya … vayāya … virāgāya … nirodhāya … cāgāya … paṭinissaggāya dve dhammā bhāvetabbā …pe…
an2.310-319:2.1.eng: “For the complete understanding … finishing … giving up … ending … vanishing … fading away … cessation … giving away … letting go of greed, two things should be developed.”

an2.320-479:1.1.pli: “Dosassa …pe… mohassa … kodhassa … upanāhassa … makkhassa … paḷāsassa … issāya … macchariyassa … māyāya … sāṭheyyassa … thambhassa … sārambhassa … mānassa … atimānassa … madassa … pamādassa … abhiññāya … pariññāya … parikkhayāya … pahānāya … khayāya … vayāya … virāgāya … nirodhāya … cāgāya … paṭinissaggāya dve dhammā bhāvetabbā.
an2.320-479:1.1.eng: “Of hate … delusion … anger … acrimony … disdain … contempt … jealousy … stinginess … deceit … deviousness … obstinacy … aggression … conceit … arrogance … vanity … negligence … for insight … complete understanding … finishing … giving up … ending … vanishing … fading away … cessation … giving away … letting go … two things should be developed.

an2.320-479:1.4.pli: Pamādassa, bhikkhave, paṭinissaggāya ime dve dhammā bhāvetabbā”ti.
an2.320-479:1.4.eng: For the letting go of negligence, these two things should be developed.”

an2.320-479:2.1.eng: That is what the Buddha said.

an2.320-479:2.2.pli: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandunti.
an2.320-479:2.2.eng: Satisfied, the mendicants approved what the Buddha said.

an2.320-479:2.4.eng: The Book of the Twos is finished.
